item.title: Providence Pensions-- Let's Call a Spade a Spade (or the COLA a Raise)
item.description: Ted Nesi has done a pretty solid job tracing the history of some awful decisions made by union-dominated boards that resulted in a significant number of retirees in the early-90s receiving 5% or 6% annually compounded interest on their retirement income. These are often called COLAs, or cost-of-living adjustments. Today, I am inspired by Nesi’s post on the rapid decline of the Providence municipal pension fund health that occurred since 6% “COLA” was introduced in 1989 through today.
